question: Let $A$ be a $4 \times 4$ all-ones matrix, which has only one non-zero eigenvalue. Suppose we want to diagonalise it. Without explicitly computing $D$, can you tell how many all-zero columns $D$ is going to have?

answers.feedback: Correct! $D$ will be a diagonal $4\times 4$-matrix with the eigenvalues of $A$ on the diagonal. Only one of these will be non-zero, so 3 columns will consist of all zeroes.
